Wi-Fi

This section is incomplete and needs further work!

Theory

Electromagentic Waves

  • Electromagnetic waves in vacuum travel at the speed of light (299,792,458m/s or 1,080,000,000km/h).
  • Electromagnetic waves do not need a medium to propagate.
  • The smaller the wavelength (distance) - the higher the frequency (speed).
  • Frequency (Hz) = Velocity of light (m/s) / Wavelength (m) so 300MHz = 1m.

Radiowaves

Theory

Access Point

  • Wireless switch.
  • Can only use one band at the time (2GHz or 5GHz) = Dual band are 2 APs covering both ranges.

Encryption

  • None
  • WEP
  • WPA
  • WPA2
  • WPA3

Wi-Fi Generations

Generation IEEE Standard Link rate (Mbit/s) Frequency (GHz)
Wi-Fi 0 802.11 1-2 2.4
Wi-Fi 1 802.11b 1-11 2.4
  • Based on IEEE 802.11 (WLAN) standard.
